active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the potential challenges an Incident Commander might face during a large-scale cyberattack (e.g., ransomware affecting multiple departments). Propose strategies for overcoming communication breakdowns and resource allocation issues, referencing ICS principles and real-world examples from sources like NIST SP 800-61.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in the topic 'Incident Commander Role and Responsibilities' (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Business Continuity Planning > Crisis Management and Incident Response > Crisis Management Team Structure > Incident Commander Role and Responsibilities). Incorporate this research context: IC is the single leader managing incident response (Splunk, Rootly); uses ICS for structure; responsibilities span preparation (establish programs), detection/response (set objectives, coordinate), recovery/post-incident (reviews); NIST defines cybersecurity incidents. Generate 40 high-quality flashcards (10 per scaffolding layer) covering all 6 Bloom's objectives. Ensure even distribution: 20% Remember/Understand, 30% Apply/Analyze, 50% Evaluate/Create. Use the exact flashcard schema: - Question/answer types: Q&A, MCQ (with distractors), Cloze. - Distractors: 3 plausible misconceptions per MCQ. - Per card: JSON with front, back, bloom_level, layer (1-4), type, explanation (why correct/wrong + example), source. Align to scaffolding layers, active learning (e.g., scenario-based for problem-solving), and objectives. Promote active recall, spaced repetition. Output ONLY a JSON array of 40 flashcards.
